description: The METEORSTORM taxonomy models converged space platform environments, functional segments, services, assets, and analytic constructs to support threat-informed engineering, detection, and resilience.

predicates.description: The Primary Capability Environment (PCE) layer defines the physical environments where the space platform segments are deployed.

values.description: Surface-based operational zones on planetary bodies.
Water-based operational zones, including but not limited to Earth's maritime domains.
Atmospheric operational zones spanning low, high, and near-space regions.
Operational zones within planetary or satellite orbits.
Operational zones beyond planetary orbital regimes.

predicates.description: The Segment layer defines the functional grouping of services and assets that provide an operational requirement for a space platform.

values.description: Surface-based services and assets for primary launch operations.
Services and assets enabling platform communications across signal paths.
Surface-based services and assets for primary platform operations, serving as the primary locus of control plane activity.
Services and assets for primary end-user operations.
Water-based services and assets for primary platform operations, not limited to Earth's maritime domains.
Aerial services and assets in the lower atmosphere.
Aerial services and assets above the lower atmosphere but below near space.
Aerial services and assets above high altitude and below orbital regions.
Services and assets operating in planetary or satellite orbits.
Services and assets operating beyond planetary orbital regimes.

predicates.description: The Service Layer defines the services delivered by hardware, firmware, software, data, signal, or hybrid assets within a space platform. Each service may operate within a single segment or be distributed across multiple segments.

values.description: Services for managing and orchestrating platform control functions.
Services for managing and orchestrating mission product functions.
Services integrating both control and data plane functionalities.

predicates.description: The Asset Layer defines the hardware, firmware, software, data, signal, or hybrid elements that enable and sustain space platform services.

values.description: Physical components supporting platform operations.
Embedded control code governing hardware functions.
Applications and logic executing operational tasks.
Information generated, processed, or consumed by the platform.
Communication channels and transmission frequencies.
Composite elements combining multiple asset types.

predicates.description: The Analytic layer provides a means to integrate security threats, resilience measures, detection signatures, indicators of attack, and indicators of compromise.

values.description: Known or modeled attack path for a converged space system.
Verifiable indication that the platform has been compromised.
Verifiable indication that the platform has been targeted.
Known or modeled threat to the platform.
Pattern, signal, or logic that triggers on contextualized threat behavior.
Protective capability ensuring resistance or recovery from threats.
